content.GPT-summary: The post is a proposal for EIP-5568: Revert Signals on Github. The author is explaining the proposal and a third party is giving constructive criticism and auditing/reviewing the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: I think this EIP should define a reevaluate instruction. That seems super common. How compatible is this with other systems that use revert reasons? I believe Gas Station Network uses something similar (but much simpler.)
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: SamWilsn:  I think this EIP should define a reevaluate instruction.   I am working on a draft for this. To avoid special cases, it will be its own (very short!) EIP.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: SamWilsn:  How compatible is this with other systems that use revert reasons? I believe Gas Station Network uses something similar (but much simpler.)   I can’t find the OpenGSN stuff, but I know that there are EIP-5289 (which I would update to use this new EIP) and EIP-3668 (which will be incompatible with this EIP).
